lines.text: Madame Magliore, I have wrongfully held back this silver which belongs to the poor. And who was this person? Evidently a poor man.

[to Valjean]
And I promise you, there is more joy in heaven over the face of an repented sinner than the white silk robes of a hundred just men.
You know nothing of me. I am a stranger to you.
It was only a stranger who held out a hand to me... once.

[Sister Simplice has told her first lie in order to save Valjean]
God bless you, sister.
Then may this falsehood be placed to your credit in paradise.

[to Marius]
Pity? You who takes sides with the scum of the streets against the government, the monarchy, against your own family? You expect to receive pity from me?
I should have known. The scoundrel joins up with the fools.
Oh sir, we're all fools for most of our lives. It's unavoidable.
There is no God. There is only the law. Good and evil do not exist outside the law.
